issue.title: Script tag handling regression in 1.20.1 and main?

labels.name: not-a-bug
labels.description: This issue is not a bug; it is working as per spec

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
In our regression tests on Apache Tika in preparation for our [3.2.0 release](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-4411), we noticed a change in script handling. A minimal reproducer is attached. When we run:

```
Path p = Paths.get("example.html");
System.out.println(Jsoup.parse(p));
```

With 1.20.1 and main, we're getting: 
```
<html>
 <head>
  <script type="application/x-javascript" src="something.js">
</head>
<body>
   this is content
</body>
</html>
</script>
 </head>
 <body></body>
</html>

[example.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20298261/example.zip)

```
With 1.19.1 we got:
```
<html>
 <head>
  <script type="application/x-javascript" src="something.js"></script>
 </head>
 <body>
  this is content
 </body>
</html>
```

body:
Hi,

I think a good approach for this will be to add the option to supply a tag customizer that is called before vending a tag in `tag#get()` / `tag#valueOf()`. And users can modify as desired.

(Not to be nit-picky but for clarity: jsoup parses [HTML](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/) (aka HTML5) or XML. It doesn't know about parsing anything called xhtml5. So I've edited the report.)

The previous behavior was incorrect against our goal of following the spec and aligning to current browsers. And in particular could lead to parser differential issues (if jsoup parses differently to how browsers do, that's possibly a path for data / XSS smuggling, depending on how things are configured).

And thanks for the thanks :) It's much appreciated.

rename.from: Consider offering a legacy handling of non-xhtml5 compliant self-closing tags?
rename.to: Consider offering a legacy handling of non-html5 compliant self-closing tags?

body:
I tested it  with a local snapshot build of 1.21.1 and I can confirm, that this improvement solves my issue with unknown possibly self-closing tags.

Some non-html5-compliant behaving tags, like a self-closing `<strong />`,  will be handled from now on differently within our code, or simply by setting it to be allowed self-closing.

Thanks a lot for the quick support.
I hope to see a release soon.

> (Not to be nit-picky but for clarity: jsoup parses [HTML](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/) (aka HTML5) or XML. It doesn't know about parsing anything called xhtml5. So I've edited the report.)

LOL...I broke my rule of not posting before finishing my coffee. Sorry. Yes, agreed. My bad.
Y. That works well. Thank you!
Great, thanks all for confirming. I don't have a date for a release as yet but it won't be far off, just planning on wrapping the select-nodes feature mostly.

issue.title: The new version Tag.java led to undesired results.

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
with new version 1.20.1, Try parsing the html: ```html

text 1

    text 2

      text 3

      ``` ```java System.out.println(Jsoup.parse(html).html()) ``` It outputs a structure like this: ```html

      text 1

        text 2

          text 3

      ``` This is not the expected structure, the desired outcome should look like this: ```html

      text 1

        text 2

          text 3

          ```
